title: Pregnant mum, 25, who punched man after he told her she was a 'bad mother' is jailed
text:
A young mother punched a man in the face and chest after he made comments about her parenting capabilities, a court has heard.

Kristina Monique Crossman, 25, was in the middle of a heated debate at a house on the Sunshine Coast in December when the man stepped in.

The victim tried to de-escalate the situation but also made comments about Crossman not deserving custody of her child.

Kristina Monique Crossman, 25, was in the middle of a heated debate at a house at Golden Beach (pictured) on the Sunshine Coast in December when the man stepped in

'That comment escalated the situation rather than de-escalated it,' duty lawyer Mark Dixon said, according to The Sunshine Coast Daily.

'She accepted… it was not the right thing to do to strike him but when faced with the complainant who is a reasonably heavy-set man she did feel intimated and she did lash out.'

'She knows she completely overreacted, she knows that violence is not acceptable, she accepts that she did the wrong thing.'

The victim's glasses were dislodged and he received a cut to his lip and nose.

Mr Dixon said that Crossman was homeless at the time of the assault but now had a stable home and was motivated to behave well because she was seven months pregnant.

Crossman pleaded guilty at Caloundra Magistrate's Court on Wednesday to a charge of assault occasioning bodily harm.

She was sentenced to a four month jail term with immediate parole.



The magistrate said there was a community expectation this kind of behaviour would not be tolerated - adding he hoped the row would be the end of the matter.

She was sentenced to four months jail at Caloundra Magistrate's Court (pictured) on Wednesday
description: A young Sunshine Coast mother who punched a man in the face and chest after he made comments about her parenting capability has been handed a jail sentence.
authors: Brett Lackey For Daily Mail Australia
